properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 5 at 1:51PM CST until February 6 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Lincoln IL
properties.description:
...SNOW AND LIGHT ICE EXPECTED THROUGH EARLY THURSDAY...

.Snow will overspread much of central Illinois through this
evening, with a mix of sleet and freezing rain near Interstate
70. Precipitation will continue overnight and into early
Thursday, with snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches for much of
central Illinois. The wintry mix will keep snow totals near 1 to 2
inches along a Shelbyville to Paris line, with ice accumulations
generally less than a tenth of an inch near and just south of the
I-70 corridor.

* WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of
1 to 3 inches north of I-70, with ice accumulations generally
less than a tenth of an inch near and just south of I-70.

* WHERE...Portions of east central and southeast Illinois. The
mixture of freezing rain and sleet is most likely near I-70
through this evening, before shifting south around midnight.
Areas north of I-70 will see mostly snow.

* WHEN...Precipitation will continue through this evening, before
slowly diminishing after midnight.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The evening commute
may be impacted, with some lingering slippery conditions for
the Thursday morning commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the
Internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST THURSDAY
